benchmark_details.name: OlympicArena
benchmark_details.overview: OlympicArena is a comprehensive, highly-challenging, and rigorously curated benchmark designed to assess cognitive reasoning abilities of LLMs and LMMs using 11,163 bilingual problems from 62 distinct Olympic competitions across seven disciplines.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To rigorously assess the cognitive reasoning abilities of AI models across multidisciplinary Olympic-level challenges.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Our benchmark inevitably introduces some noisy problems and is currently limited to evaluating modelsâ€™ abilities to solve complex problems.

data.source: Collection of problems from 62 distinct Olympic competitions and publicly available URLs.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by approximately 30 students with backgrounds in science and engineering.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on correctness of answers and correctness of reasoning steps.
methodology.interpretation: Performance is evaluated not just on final accuracy but also on the correctness of the reasoning processes.
methodology.baseline_results: Even advanced models like GPT-4o only achieve a 39.97% overall accuracy on the benchmark.
methodology.validation: The benchmark incorporates data leakage detection experiments to ensure its effectiveness.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The benchmark includes bilingual problems and aims to support diverse participants.
targeted_risks.harm: The benchmark aims to evaluate and improve cognitive reasoning in AI systems while considering ethical implications.
